sentences.en: A comparative expensive unit from a reputable instrument firm is a wise investment.
sentences.cn: 购买有名气的厂家的较贵的器械是一种明智的投资.

sentences.en: a comparative study of the educational systems of two countries
sentences.cn: 两国教育制度的比较研究

sentences.en: After a lifetime of poverty, his last few years were spent in comparable comfort.
sentences.cn: 他穷了一辈子，最后几年还算过得比较舒适。

sentences.en: After many hardships, he now lives in comparative ease.
sentences.cn: 经过许多困难之后, 他现在的生活相对舒适.

sentences.en: From comparative neglect, his reputation has soared to the heights.
sentences.cn: 从前人们对他不大注意, 现在声望陡升.

sentences.en: I got my degree in comparative literature.
sentences.cn: 我得的学位是比较文学.

sentences.en: In this respect, the proceeding was functionally similar to a comparative licensing adjudication.
sentences.cn: 在这一点上, 手续在作用上即类似于比较许可证发放的裁断.

sentences.en: It flies in the face of the principle of comparative advantage.
sentences.cn: 它回避了比较利益的原则.

sentences.en: Let's make a comparative study of the two languages.
sentences.cn: 让我们将这两种语言作一下比较研究.

sentences.en: My dear ones, I will not make a comparative analysis.
sentences.cn: 我亲爱的同胞, 我不要再作比较.

sentences.en: She didn’t want to leave the comparative safety of the shelter.
sentences.cn: 她不愿离开相对来说还算安全的掩蔽处。

sentences.en: She escaped to the comparative serenity of the kitchen.
sentences.cn: 她逃到相对安静的厨房里.

sentences.en: The exclusively comparative method brought in a set of false notions.
sentences.cn: 这种单纯的比较方法引起了一系列错误的观念.

sentences.en: The island or castle stood in this belt of comparative light.
sentences.cn: 小岛,就是这小寨,正好在这条淡淡的发光的水迹上.

sentences.en: The log - house was full of smoke, to which we owed our comparative safety.
sentences.cn: 木屋里到处是硝烟, 可也多亏了这硝烟,我们的情况才不至于太糟.

sentences.en: To illustrate my point I have done a comparative analysis.
sentences.cn: 为说明我的观点,我做了对比分析.

words.tran_cn: 比较；对照；比喻；比较关系

phrases.tran_cn: 比较广告；（指名与竞争对手产品进行比较的）货比货式广告

trans.tran_en: the comparative form of an adjective or adverb shows an increase in size, quality, degree etc when it is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative form of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative form of ‘slowly’.
